content.description: The start is the crux. Sit start on a sloper rail with poor feet. Move right hand to pocket and then left hand to another pocket to top out. Stay left of the arete. Around the comer is off.
content.location: Back of Pig boulder on a slightly overhung face.

content.description: Hasn't been tried. Stand start on the Pig's snout and work left campusing the lip of the overhang until you reach the slab then top out.
content.location: Start with your hands on the Pig boulder's snout and work left.

content.description: Start at the junction of the roof and the slab then work up with some delicate footwork and hand-foot matches.
content.location: Just to the left of the roof at the start of the slab.

content.description: Start to the right of the snout of the Pig Boulder in the little cave on the obvious rail. Work up and left to a small horn above the roof and then a tricky mantle or hand-foot match to top out.
content.location: Right of the prow/snout and down in the cave.

content.description: Start on the slight rise in the slab to the right of Guanciale. Find scant feet and work up the side-pull rail to the top.
content.location: Just to the right of Guanciale.

content.description: Sit start using the sloper rail from Swine Quarters and the jug around the arete to the right. Work up the arete using holds on both sides.
content.location: Just to the right of Swine Quarters on the back of the Pig boulder.

content.description: Stand start at the edge of the arete about 8 feet to the left of Swine Quarters. Work right and up the arete using arete and face holds. Some fancy footwork makes it easier.
content.location: The arete 8 feet to the left of Swine Quarters.

content.description: Start on a sideways half-moon on the slab part of the Pig boulder. Go up to a layback edge near the arete and get high feet to then shoot a hand to the top to top out.
content.location: On the side of the pig boulder that is very slabby. Just as the slab turns to an overhang around the arete is a sideways half moon to start on.

content.description: Sit start about 3 feet to the right of Bacon Arete. Work into two harder moves up the arete then traverse right to finish at the top of the arete.
content.location: In between Swine Quarters and Bacon.

content.description: Really cool boulder 100 feet straight back from Fat Bastard...looks like a pig from the front.  Amazing prow that could have a really hard problem.  Easy problem lookers right of prow, some slab problems along the side and two fun sit starts on the back side.
